item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Biting's excellent. It's like kissing - only there is a winner." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Life is a journey. Time is a river. The door is ajar" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is clear that the books owned the shop rather than the other way about. Everywhere they had run wild and taken possession of their habitat, breeding and multiplying, and clearly lacking any strong hand to keep them down." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Sorry," [Hamlet] said, rubbing his temples. "I don't know what came over me. All of a sudden I had this overwhelming desire to talk for a very long time without actually doing anything." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Death and Famine and War and Pollution continued biking towards Tadfield. And Grievous Bodily Harm, Cruelty To Animals, Things Not Working Properly Even After You've Given Them A Good Thumping but secretly No Alcohol Lager, and Really Cool People travelled with them." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"You're Hell's Angels, then? What chapter are you from?'
'REVELATIONS. CHAPTER SIX." -- Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Gatsby turned out all right at the end; it is what preyed on Gatsby, what foul dust floated in the wake of his dreams that temporarily closed out my interest in the abortive sorrows and short-winded elations of men." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Only cops and vampires have to have an invitation to enter." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Eric moved the broom experimentally and made an attempt to sweep the glass into the pan while it lay in the middle of the floor. Of course, the pan slid away. Eric scowled. I'd finally found something Eric did poorly." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "I have lived one step away from losing my mind for years. I am quick and accurate in spotting unstable streaks in others." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "True love is the best thing in the world, except for cough drops." -- William Goldman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Katherine Howe
item.description: "But remember. Just because you don't believe in something doesn't mean it isn't real." -- Katherine Howe

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Louis Bayard
item.description: "Well, as to that, all I'll say is, you can't take out a fellow's heart before he's ready to give it up." -- Louis Bayard

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Most of the bad guys in the real world don't know that they are bad guys. You don't get a flashing warning sign that you're about to damn yourself. It sneaks up on you when you aren't looking." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Caring about someone isn't complicated. It isn't easy. But it isn't complicated, either. Kinda like lifting the engine block out of a car." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Every soul is special. They’re all beautiful. They’re all far more significant than anyone on this rock realizes. I think when people are at their best, they’re acting in accordance with their soul. The ones who have gone bad don’t have bad souls. They’ve just given up on keeping in touch with them." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You're no help," he told the lime. This was unfair. It was only a lime; there was nothing special about it at all. It was doing the best it could." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "Beware the dark pool at the bottom of our hearts. In its icy, black depths dwell strange and twisted creatures it is best not to disturb." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Few are those who see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "The only water in the forest is the River." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Sue Grafton
Charlotte add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Richard Kadrey
item.description: "Memories are bullets. Some whiz by and only spook you. Others tear you open and leave you in pieces." -- Richard Kadrey

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All that glisters is not gold; Often have you heard that told: Many a man his life hath sold But my outside to behold: Gilded tombs do worms enfold." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Charlotte add a quote by Tana French
item.description: "What I am telling you, before you begin my story, is this -- two things: I crave truth. And I lie. " -- Tana French
